[I]_p19785 got ready food: but [she]_p19786 would not eat, simply saying that [she]_p19787 had not hunger. [I]_p19788 did not press her, knowing [her]_p19789 unavailingness. But [I]_p19791 [myself]_p19793 eat, for [I]_p19792 must needs now be strong for all.

Then, with the fear on [me]_p19794 of what might be, [I]_p19795 drew a ring so big for [her]_p19798 comfort, round where [Madam]_n2404 Mina sat and over the ring [I]_p19796 passed some of the wafer, and [I]_p19796 broke [it]_p19799 fine so that all was well guarded. [She]_p19800 sat still all the time, so still as one dead and [she]_p19801 grew whiter and ever whiter till the snow was not more pale and no word [she]_p19802 said. But when [I]_p19803 drew near, [she]_p19805 clung to me, and [I]_p19804 could know that the poor soul shook [her]_p19806 from head to feet with a tremor that was pain to feel. [I]_p19807 said to [her]_p19809 presently, when [she]_p19810 had grown more quiet:,   "Will [you]_p19812 not come over to the fire?" for [I]_p19808 wished to make a test of what [she]_p19811 could. [She]_p19813 rose obedient, but when [she]_p19814 have made a step [she]_p19815 stopped, and stood as one stricken. "Why not go on?" [I]_p19816 asked. [She]_p19817 shook [her]_p19818 head, and, coming back, sat down in [her]_p19819 place. Then, looking at [me]_p19820 with open eyes, as of one waked from sleep, [she]_p19821 said simply:,   "I cannot!" and remained silent. [I]_p19822 rejoiced, for [I]_p19823 knew that what [she]_p19824 could not, none of those that [we]_p19825 dreaded could. Though there might be danger to [her]_p19826 body, yet [her]_p19827 soul was safe!  Presently the horses began to scream, and tore at [their]_p19828 tethers till [I]_p19829 came to [them]_p19830 and quieted them.

When [they]_p19832 did feel [my]_p19834 hands on them, [they]_p19833 whinnied low as in joy, and licked at [my]_p19835 hands and were quiet for a time. Many times through the night did [I]_p19836 come to them, till [it]_p19837 arrive to the cold hour when all nature is at lowest and every time [my]_p19838 coming was with quiet of them. In the cold hour the fire began to die, and [I]_p19839 was about stepping forth to replenish it, for now the snow came in flying sweeps and with [it]_p19840 a chill mist. Even in the dark there was a light of some kind, as there ever is over snow and [it]_p19842 seemed as though the snow-flurries and the wreaths of mist took shape as of women with trailing garments. All was in dead, grim silence only that the horses whinnied and cowered, as if in terror of the worst. [I]_p19843 began to fear, horrible fears but then came to [me]_p19845 the sense of safety in that ring wherein [I]_p19844 stood. [I]_p19846 began, too, to think that [my]_p19848 imaginings were of the night, and the gloom, and the unrest that [I]_p19847 have gone through, and all the terrible anxiety. [It]_p19849 was as though [my]_p19850 memories of all Jonathan's horrid experience were befooling [me]_p19851 for the snow flakes and the mist began to wheel and circle round, till [I]_p19852 could get as though a shadowy glimpse of those women that would have kissed him. And then the horses cowered lower and lower, and moaned in terror as men do in pain. Even the madness of fright was not to them, so that [they]_p19853 could break away.

[I]_p19854 feared for [my]_p19855 [dear Madam Mina]_n2405 when these weird figures drew near and circled round. [I]_p19856 looked at her, but [she]_p19858 sat calm, and smiled at [me]_p19860 when [I]_p19857 would have stepped to the fire to replenish it, [she]_p19859 caught [me]_p19861 and held [me]_p19861 back, and whispered, like a voice that one hears in a dream, so low [it]_p19863 was:,   "No! No! Do not go without. Here [you]_p19865 are safe!" [I]_p19868 turned to her, and looking in [her]_p19873 eyes, said:,   "But you? [It]_p19877 is for [you]_p19866 that [I]_p19869 fear!" whereat [she]_p19878 laughed, a laugh, low and unreal, and said:,   "Fear for me! Why fear for me? None safer in all the world from [them]_p19879 than [I]_p19869 am," and as [I]_p19870 wondered at the meaning of [her]_p19874 words, a puff of wind made the flame leap up, and [I]_p19870 see the red scar on [her]_p19874 forehead. Then, alas! [I]_p19880 knew. Did [I]_p19881 not, [I]_p19882 would soon have learned, for the wheeling figures of mist and snow came closer, but keeping ever without the [Holy]_n2406 circle. Then [they]_p19883 began to materialise till, if God have not take away [my]_p19885 reason, for [I]_p19887 saw [it]_p19888 through [my]_p19886 eyes, there were before [me]_p19889 in actual flesh the same three women that Jonathan saw in the room, when [they]_p19884 would have kissed [his]_p19890 throat. [I]_p19891 knew the swaying round forms, the bright hard eyes, the white teeth, the ruddy colour, the voluptuous lips. [They]_p19892 smiled ever at poor [dear]_n2407 Madam Mina and as [their]_p19893 laugh came through the silence of the night, [they]_p19895 twined [their]_p19894 arms and pointed to her, and said in those so sweet tingling tones that Jonathan said were of the intolerable sweetness of the water-glasses:, "Come, sister. Come to us. Come! Come!" In fear [I]_p19896 turned to [my]_p19897 poor Madam Mina, and [my]_p19898 heart with gladness leapt like flame for oh! the terror in [her]_p19900 sweet eyes, the repulsion, the horror, told a story to [my]_p19898 heart that was all of hope.

God be thanked [she]_p19901 was not, yet, of them. [I]_p19902 seized some of the firewood which was by me, and holding out some of the [Wafer]_n,2408 advanced on [them]_p19903 towards the fire. [They]_p19904 drew back before me, and laughed [their]_p19905 low horrid laugh. [I]_p19906 fed the fire, and feared [them]_p19908 not for [I]_p19907 knew that [we]_p19909 were safe within [our]_p19910 protections. [They]_p19911 could not approach, me, whilst so armed, nor [Madam]_n2409 Mina whilst [she]_p19912 remained within the ring, which [she]_p19913 could not leave no more than [they]_p19914 could enter. The horses had ceased to moan, and lay still on the ground the snow fell on [them]_p19915 softly, and [they]_p19916 grew whiter. [I]_p19917 knew that there was for the [poor]_n2410 beasts no more of terror. And so [we]_p19918 remained till the red of the dawn to fall through the snow-gloom. [I]_p19919 was desolate and afraid, and full of woe and terror but when that beautiful sun began to climb the horizon life was to [me]_p19920 again. At the first coming of the dawn the horrid figures melted in the whirling mist and snow the wreaths of transparent gloom moved away towards the castle, and were lost.

Instinctively, with the dawn coming, [I]_p19921 turned to [Madam]_n2411 Mina, intending to hypnotise [her]_p19923 but [she]_p19925 lay in a deep and sudden sleep, from which [I]_p19922 could not wake her. [I]_p19926 tried to hypnotise through [her]_p19927 sleep, but [she]_p19928 made no response, none at all and the day broke. [I]_p19929 fear yet to stir. [I]_p19930 have made [my]_p19931 fire and have seen the horses, [they]_p19932 are all dead. [To-day]_n2412 [I]_p19933 have much to do here, and [I]_p19934 keep waiting till the sun is up high for there may be places where [I]_p19934 must go, where that sunlight, though snow and mist obscure it, will be to [me]_p19936 a safety. , With the dawn [we]_p19955 saw the body of Szgany before [us]_p19956 dashing away from the river with [their]_p19957 leiter-wagon. , [I]_p19967 am at least sane. Thank God for that mercy at all events, though the proving [it]_p19968 has been dreadful. So [he]_p20016 delay, and delay, and delay, till the mere beauty and the fascination of the wanton [Un-Dead]_n2426 have hypnotise [him]_p20018 and [he]_p20017 remain on and on, till sunset come, and the [Vampire]_n2427 sleep be over. There is some fascination, surely, when [I]_p20019 am moved by the mere presence of such an one, even lying as [she]_p20020 lay in a tomb fretted with age and heavy with the dust of centuries, though there be that horrid odour such as the lairs of the Count have had. To begin twice more after [I]_p20074 had been through a deed of horror for if [it]_p20075 was terrible with the sweet Miss Lucy, what would [it]_p20076 not be with these strange ones who had survived through centuries, and who had been strengthened by the passing of the years who would, if [they]_p20077 could, have fought for [their]_p20078 foul lives. Had [I]_p20085 not seen the repose in the first place, and the gladness that stole over [it]_p20087 just ere the final dissolution came, as realisation that the soul had been won, [I]_p20086 could not have gone further with [my]_p20088 butchery. And the poor souls, [I]_p20093 can pity [them]_p20095 now and weep, as [I]_p20094 think of [them]_p20096 placid each in [her]_p20097 full sleep of death for a short moment ere fading. Before [I]_p20102 left the castle [I]_p20103 so fixed [its]_p20100 entrances that never more can the Count enter there Un-Dead. When [I]_p20105 stepped into the circle where [Madam]_n2438 Mina slept, [she]_p20107 woke from [her]_p20108 sleep, and, seeing, me, cried out in pain that [I]_p20106 had endured too much. "Come!" " [She]_p20114 was looking thin and pale and weak but [her]_p20115 eyes were pure and glowed with fervour. Mina Harker's [Journal]_n2440. 6 November. , [It]_p20124 was late in the afternoon when the [Professor]_n2441 and [I]_p20125 took [our]_p20127 way towards the east whence [I]_p20126 knew Jonathan was coming. [They]_p20147 were far off, but the sound, even though coming muffled through the deadening snowfall, was full of terror. [He]_p20154 had found a wonderful spot, a sort of natural hollow in a rock, with an entrance like a doorway between two boulders. " [He]_p20162 brought in [our]_p20163 furs, and made a snug nest for me, and got out some provisions and forced [them]_p20164 upon me. But [I]_p20165 could not eat to even try to do so was repulsive to me, and, much as [I]_p20166 would have liked to please him, [I]_p20166 could not bring [myself]_p20168 to the attempt. When the snow storm abated a moment [we]_p20238 looked again. [It]_p20239 was strange to see the snow falling in such heavy flakes close to us, and beyond, the sun shining more and more brightly as [it]_p20240 sank down towards the far mountain tops. Closer and closer [they]_p20265 drew. [His]_p20388 mother holds, [I]_p20389 know, the secret belief that some of [our]_p20390 brave friend's spirit has passed into him. [His]_p20391 bundle of names links all [our]_p20392 little band of men together but [we]_p20393 call [him]_p20394 [Quincey]_n2468. In the summer of this year [we]_p20395 made a journey to [Transylvania]_n,2469 and went over the old ground which was, and is, to [us]_p20396 so full of vivid and terrible memories. [It]_p20397 was almost impossible to believe that the things which [we]_p20398 had seen with [our]_p20399 own eyes and heard with [our]_p20400 own ears were living truths. Every trace of all that had been was blotted out. The castle stood as before, reared high above a waste of desolation. When [we]_p20401 got home [we]_p20402 were talking of the old time, which [we]_p20402 could all look back on without despair, for [Godalming]_n2470 and [Seward]_n2471 are both happily married. [I]_p20404 took the papers from the safe where [they]_p20405 had been ever since [our]_p20406 return so long ago.

[We]_p20407 were struck with the fact, that in all the mass of material of which the record is composed, there is hardly one authentic document nothing but a mass of typewriting, except the later note-books of Mina and [Seward]_n2472 and myself, and [Van Helsing]_n's2473 memorandum. [We]_p20408 could hardly ask any one, even did [we]_p20409 wish to, to accept these as proofs of so wild a story. [Van Helsing]_n2474 summed [it]_p20410 all up as [he]_p20411 said, with [our]_p20412 boy on [his]_p20413 knee:, "We want no proofs [we]_p20415 ask none to believe us! This boy will some day know what a brave and gallant woman [his]_p20414 mother is. Already [he]_p20416 knows [her]_p20418 sweetness and loving care later on [he]_p20417 will understand how some men so loved her, that [they]_p20421 did dare much for [her]_p20419 sake. " [JONATHAN HARKER]_n2475.
